VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Calculate Tax at Checkout

Ensure that your storefront complies with federal and local regulations for collecting sales tax. B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides a default object for defining simple tax rates for US states or Canadian provinces. By default, B2B Commerce for Visualforce calculates the cart's tax based on a shipping address and the included products.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create and edit custom tabs:	Customize Application
To create custom list views:	

Read on the type of record included in the list

AND

Create and Customize List Views


To create CC Tax Rate records:	Create on CC Tax Rates
To modify CC Product records:	Edit on CC Products
To view page layouts:	View Setup and Configuration
To customize page layouts:	Customize Application
To edit account records:	Edit on accounts
To set default sharing access:	Manage Sharing

You can also disable tax calculation in the following ways:

Exclude certain products from the cart's tax calculation
Exclude certain accounts from being subject to tax
Disable tax calculation for an entire storefront
IMPORTANT The default CC Tax Rate object and ccrz.cc_hk_TaxCalculation extension point class in the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API are intended for demonstration purposes only. This object and API aren't meant to be used as-is in a production org. Instead, they provide a starting point that you can extend for implementing the tax calculations that are specific to your solution. Or, integrate an external tax calculation service, such as Avalara, and install the service's add-on, if available.
NOTE The default tax calculation isn't compatible with line-level independence (LLI) checkout.

To set up the default tax rates:

To enable tax calculation for your storefront, make sure that the Skip Tax Calculation storefront setting is disabled. Follow the steps in Show Fees and Charges in the Order Review Section of the Checkout Page.
In your org, click the CC Tax Rates tab.
TIP Don’t see the CC Tax Rates tab? You can Create a Custom Object Tab.
On the CC Tax Rates tab, optionally create a custom list view so that you can easily compare tax rates:
Create a custom list view.
Create or Clone a List View in Lightning Experience
Create a Custom List View in Salesforce Classic
Show the following fields, and save your changes:
Country Code
State Code
Tax Rate
Create a CC Tax Rate record.
On the CC Tax Rates tab, click New.
For State Code, enter the ISO 3166-2 code for a US state or Canadian province, such as IA.
For Country Code, enter the ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 country or region code, such as US.
For Tax Rate, enter the appropriate value for the State Code as a percent, such as 6.000.
Save your changes. Repeat these steps for each US state or province
Enable the Taxable field on each product that is subject to tax during checkout.
On the CC Products tab, select a product, and click Edit.
Enable Taxable.
Save your changes. Repeat these products for each taxable product.
Add the tax exempt field to the account page layout.
Find the page layouts for the standard account object.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select Account, and then scroll to the Page Layouts section.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Account in the Quick Find box in Setup. Select Page Layouts under Accounts.
Click Account Layout.
From Fields, drag TaxExemptAccount to the Account Detail section in the page layout.
Save your changes.
Edit the accounts that you want to exclude from tax.
On the Accounts tab in your org, select an account, and click Edit.
To exclude the account from tax, enable TaxExemptAccount.
Save your changes.
To ensure that authenticated buyers can view the tax information during checkout, update the sharing settings for the CC Tax Rate object.
From Setup, enter Sharing Settings in the Quick Find box, and then select Sharing Settings.
In the Organization-Wide Defaults section, click Edit.
Scroll to the CC Tax Rate object.
In the Default External Access column, select Public Read Only.
Save your changes.
If your storefront allows a guest buyer to check out, create a sharing rule for the CC Tax Rate object. Complete the steps in Create Sharing Rules for Guest User Access to Storefront Objects.

Tax is calculated and shown in the Order Review section of the Checkout page when all the following conditions are true:

The Skip Tax Calculation option in the storefront settings is disabled.
The TaxExemptAccount field on the buyer's account is disabled.
The storefront defines a CC Tax Rate record for the state or province used in the cart's shipping address.
The cart contains at least one product where the Taxable field is enabled.
You've specified the appropriate sharing settings for the CC Tax Rate object.
